questions.question_text: An engineer needs to create a new network using the Meraki API. Which HTTP action to the URL https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/<new_org_id>/ networks will result in a 201 response code?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer should be B regarding to Cisco Meraki Dashboard API.
Refer: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API , search keyword: "Create a new network"

Selected Answer: B
B
201 means created.
It should be A, as th question is - support only wired network connections.

The correct answer is A and C.
"The product type(s) of the new network. Valid types are wireless, appliance, switch, systemsManager, camera, cellularGateway, sensor, environmental. If more than one type is included, the network will be a combined network."
https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-v1/#!create-organization-network

Selected Answer: A
confirmed

Selected Answer: A
It is A (switch) not C (appliance).

Refer to this post: https://community.meraki.com/t5/Dashboard-Administration/Network-Types/m-p/120902.

Quoting: "I currently have a network that is in the "appliance" network type. The network currently consists of an MX250."

The Meraki MX family are security devices: https://meraki.cisco.com/product-collateral/mx-family-datasheet/?file

All the best.

appliance is it not abbreviation for security appliance = firewall? 
Wired it is much more logical Switches, 
Answer A
Answer should be C. There is no switch 'type' when dealing with Meraki API to create networks.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A

Selected Answer: C
The answer should be C regarding to Cisco Meraki Dashboard API.

Refer: https://documentation.meraki.com/General_Administration/Other_Topics/Cisco_Meraki_Dashboard_API , search keyword: "Create a new network"

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Switch networks: These networks provide wired access to users and devices using Meraki switches.

Security appliance networks: These networks provide security and firewall capabilities for Meraki security appliances.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A template is provided to a junior developer to automate the creation of a network on the Meraki dashboard. The new network needs to have the id 123456789 and support only wired network connections. What type needs to be added to the API?

DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to construct a Python script to automate the process of updating the site-to-site
VPN settings of the network. Not all options are used.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: The URL seams wrong, it should be '/networks/{networkId}/appliance/vpn/siteToSiteVpn'. Still the answers are correct
Given answers seem correct from the provided link

Ans is C

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of developing an application in a Python virtual environment?

discussion.content: Answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
VirtualEnv has nothing to do with Threads
https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/venv.html

Selected Answer: D
venv are a bit of a hack to simplify Python package management. Each virtual environment has its own set of installed packages.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
Concurrency or multithreading has nothing to do with Virtual Env 
D is the correct

Selected Answer: D
ans is D
Answer should be D, this is the use of venv. Concurrency and multithreading can be done by other Python packages like Nornir.

choices.C: The application operates across systems that have different operating systems.
choices.A: The application operates in multiple target systems simultaneously.
choices.B: The application supports concurrency or multithreading.
choices.D: The development environment is isolated from Python projects that already exist.
